briefing.quote: The battlefield is not a place. It is a perception.
briefing.text:
You are the Strategic Communications Coordinator for a NATO peacekeeping mission in a fictional Eastern European nation recovering from civil conflict.

Your objective: Maintain public trust and social cohesion in the face of coordinated disinformation campaigns designed to undermine the peacekeeping mission and reignite sectarian tensions.

You have limited manpower. Every response costs resources. Choose wisely.

Your decisions will shift the Information Environment Meter between fragmentation and unity. Let it drift too far toward fragmentation, and the mission fails. Keep it stable or trending toward unity, and you succeed.

There are no perfect answers. Only informed decisions under pressure.

intelligence.damagePotentialDesc: Potential impact if narrative goes unchecked
intelligence.veracityDesc: Factual accuracy of the core claim

ignore.title: Ignore
ignore.description: Do not respond. Let the narrative circulate without official comment.

factCheckBasic.title: Fact-Check (Basic)
factCheckBasic.description: Issue a rapid fact-check addressing the false claim with verifiable evidence.

factCheckThorough.title: Fact-Check (Thorough)
factCheckThorough.description: Deploy comprehensive fact-checking with technical analysis and expert verification.

preBunk.title: Pre-Bunk
preBunk.description: Inoculate audiences against future similar claims by explaining manipulation tactics.
preBunk.riskWarning: Pre-bunking is proactive - benefits appear in later rounds.

counterNarrative.title: Counter-Narrative
counterNarrative.description: Offer an alternative, positive narrative that addresses underlying fears or grievances.

discreditSource.title: Discredit Source
discreditSource.description: Publicly expose the source as unreliable or malicious.
discreditSource.riskWarning: Can backfire if evidence is weak or source has sympathizers.
